direction.raw_text: . TRIBECA GRAND HOTEL - NIGHT 69 Sidney is waiting in the lobby. A slightly spaced YOUNG WOMAN approaches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister Young?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Sophie Maes' assistant. I'm afraid Sophie isn't here right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking past her) Look I know she's in. I'm not a stalker. I just know she's upset about losing her dog and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She isn't here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, can I at least check that she got my present?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Did you send the flowers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flowers? Yeah,'cos she doesn't get enough flowers, does she? No, I sent her the fish. The Young Woman looks suddenly nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gold-fish. In a bowl. Did she get them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, but...they were dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All of them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. It was kinda shocking. Were they dead when you sent them? Sidney stares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? No, they were... Who sends people dead fish?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mafia?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BAR - EVENING 70 Alison sits at the bar, staring at her notebook, a pen held in her hand. A WHITE RUSSIAN sits on the bar beside her. Sidney slides onto the stool beside her. She looks up and sees he is holding a glass bowl of water with three dead fish in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, you're like a serial killer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This wasn't me. (Beat) I...I laid him to rest. Cuba I mean. I took him over to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to know. Alison checks the door, looking for someone, a little uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. (Beat) Well, I just...I just wanted to say...about not telling them...I really appreciated it. It was good of you and, and...you know...not many people would, uh... He stops, tongue-tied. Alison takes pity on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you? Alison sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't need my help to screw up here, Sidney. I mean, the only things you make are mistakes and stains. The BARMAN arrives, stares at the bowl of fish disapprovingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (following his gaze) Just a couple of straws please. Stony-faced, the Barman walks off. Despite herself, Alison smiles. Sidney smiles back. He notices Alison's NOTEBOOK on the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I ask you something? How come you've always got the notebook? Is it a diary or something? Am I in it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's...it's a novel I'm working on, alright?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead. I know. I'm a walking cliche.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No - a novel, that's...that's pretty impressive. You're writing it by hand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it...I don't know. It keeps it separate from the magazine work. Makes it seem special. He stares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're full of surprises, Sister. Suddenly he notices the White Russian beside them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...you waiting for your boyfriend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, yeah, so...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he do, the mystery guy? Is he a hack too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually he's a poet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? What's he look like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just most poets you see aren't really good-looking, are they? Spend their time stuck in a room, end up looking like Golem. Is he...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's very handsome, thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I don't understand? You're desperate to get a story in the magazine - so why wouldn't you play ball with Eleanor, write the puff-piece?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I resent being bribed to gush sycophantically about a star, okay? I choose to gush sycophantically. Alison stares at Sidney trying to figure him out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay anyway. Clayton's given me a story. I'm on my way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's good. Sidney smiles back at her. They look at each other...it's almost the start of a MOMENT... Then suddenly on the TV above the bar, a MOVIE TRAILER begins. Distracted Sidney turns to watch - it's Sophie Maes' new film - The Suffragette - Sophie, a glamorous Emily Pankhurst... Sidney looks back to Alison but she has turned away, suddenly awkward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, well...better get going.(Leaving) You take my advice, you'll get yourself a boyfriend who's going to show up once in a while. He leaves. Beat. Alison stares at the empty stool beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MEETING ROOM - MORNING 71 Clayton is rounding up another staff meeting. Sidney sits trying to contain his excitement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which makes it...a half page left. Lawrence? Any ideas?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Rachel Petkoff, fabulous sixties actress, one of my all time favourites. Just made a wonderful movie called Five Boroughs. I think she's poised for a come-back and I think we should get there first, do a profile. Sidney stares at him in disbelief. He looks over to Alison who avoids his gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds good. Let's do it. Okay that's it people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh...Clayton?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you read my story on Vincent Lepak? Clayton frowns down at some papers, feigning distraction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Oh, yeah. That's...that's not going to work. Sidney can't believe it. Clayton gets up to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, and for those who haven't heard, Alison is going to be running the I Spy section from now on as Lawrence here has just gone up in the world. He is replacing Greg Roberts as Deputy Editor. Lawrence smiles modestly as the room applauds. Sidney looks like he is going to implode.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CORRIDOR - LATER 72 Maddox passes Sidney in the corridor. Sidney glares after him. Suddenly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel Petkoff? One of your favourite actresses? You'd never fucking heard of her! That was my idea! Lawrence stops and turns back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So it was. You have any more good ideas don't forget to bring them to my new office. He is about to walk on but remembers something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the way, there've been complaints about you skulking around the water-cooler, trying to talk to women. It's inappropriate behaviour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? You spend half your life chatting up the staff!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I do it it's called flirting. When you do it it's called sexual harassment. Consider this an official warning. I won't tolerate sexist behaviour. He walks off. Sidney glowers after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAWRENCE MADDOX'S OFFICE - DAY 73 Lawrence is holding a meeting in his new office - half a dozen heads of departments sit around drinking coffee. Lawrence sits behind his desk, enjoying his new authority.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that wasn't Greg's way of working but Greg isn't deputy editor any more. I am, and I'm making changes. There is a knock at the door and Sidney walks in with an attractive BLONDE WOMAN in a long coat and dark glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, Lawrence? This lady's been looking for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the woman) Can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you Lawrence Maddox? The new deputy editor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I've just come to say congratulations on your promotion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. I'm sorry, you are...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm your present. The Woman produces a Beat-Box from behind her back and switches it on. She drops her coat to reveal underwear and stockings underneath. Maddox stares in frozen horror as the STRIPPER dances over to him, removing her bra.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INGRID'S OFFICE - DAY 74 A Very Well-Dressed Middle-Aged Woman knocks on the door and enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Mrs Harding. Two Impeccably-Dressed Little Girls follow Mrs Harding into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God! So adorable!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the Little Girls) And this is the Fashion Department. [To Ingrid] Where's Mr Maddox now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh he's down the hall. Room 217.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MADDOX'S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS 75 The staff are staring transfixed as the stripper gyrates her breasts, whirling NIPPLE TASSELS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with mock horror) Uh, Lawrence? This is...this is sort of inappropriate isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . His words are muffled by the bra the stripper drapes over his face. Gleefully, Sidney dances in the background. He produces a camera and starts to snap away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God, this is...this is awful...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MADDOX'S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS 77 The Stripper, who we suddenly realise is BOB THE TRANSEXUAL in a blonde wig, whips off his/her panties. There is a collective gasp from the room. Sidney can't stop laughing. Suddenly he notices everyone in the room is now staring at the door. He turns to see Mrs Harding and her girls standing, shell-shocked, in the doorway. Alarmed, Sidney side-steps in towards Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - GIRLS' P.O.V Bob, impressive breasts bared, stands staring back at us. Sidney, in the absence of anything else to shield him with, is HOLDING BOB'S PENIS. The rest of the staff stare at us, rabbits caught in headlights. After a beat Lawrence peers around Sidney, a rictus smile on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Mrs Harding. Girls...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OUTSIDE CLAYTON'S OFFICE - LATER 78 Sidney sits waiting, obsessively cleaning his hand with a wet-wipe. Through the glass partition we can see Clayton and Eleanor Johnson in the office. They are apparently discussing a mock-up of a new cover for Sharps. After a moment Eleanor comes out of the office and sweeps past Sidney without a glance. Clayton appears in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLAYTON HARDING'S OFFICE - MOMENTS LATER 79 Sidney sits in front of Clayton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know it was Take Our Daughters To Work Day. I didn't even know there was a Take Our daughters To Work Day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up. (Beat) You know, when I told my wife I'd hired another Brit, she was excited. She still thinks you're all like something from Pride and Prejudice. But you Sidney ...you're like a British person born in New Jersey. (Shaking his head) Why did I hire you? Sidney stares at his feet. Suddenly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know - why did you hire me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had an attack of nostalgia. It's passed. Like gas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was wrong with my story?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you kill my Vincent Lepak story?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't good enough. Plain and simple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't good enough?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't do hatchet jobs here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It isn't a hatchet job!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This opening quotation - "It's only too easy to catch people's attention by doing something worse than anyone else has dared do it before..." Who are you thinking of here? Vincent or yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a talentless, pretentious little twat who thinks cinema began with Tarantino and someone needs to say it. And you told me to do something with teeth! You said...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying to run a fucking magazine here! Sidney stares at him, angry and disappointed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: free press is the last defence against the Tyranny of Stupidity."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Save me your tin-pot philosophy, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It isn't mine. It's yours. First issue of Snipe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, grow the fuck up, will ya! You're not Robin Hood and you never were. You bitch about famous people for the same reason I bitched about them. Because they got invited to the Party and you didn't. Well you're at the Party now so quit bitching and do your job! You're on your last life here, you understand? One more fuck up like today and you're gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Won't you have to run a decision like that past Eleanor first? For a second Clayton looks like he might throw his ashtray at Sidney. Then he controls himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out. Sidney crosses to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he can't help himself) Looks like I was too late to save you after all. He walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OPEN-PLAN OFFICE - DAY 80 Sidney walks back through the magazine's open plan area. CO- WORKERS stop whatever they're doing and watch him pass in silence. Then, slowly, one of them begins to CLAP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Someone else joins in. Then someone else. Soon they're all clapping. Someone gets up on their desk, then another... Sidney smiles faintly then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: out of HIS DAY-DREAM. Everyone around him is working as always, paying him no attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLAYTON HARDING'S HOUSE - THE HAMPTONS - DAY 81 We are TRACKING through Magazine Staff, celebrities, politicians and children as they mill about the lawns of the sprawling mansion, enjoying the Fourth Of July celebrations which are in progress. Clayton greets guests - the perfect host. We find Sidney, wearing unfashionable shorts, socks and shoes. He is talking to Alison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hired a stripper?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't "hire" him. Bob did it for a favour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you wanted to be a success here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do! It's just...(ruefully) It wasn't me. It was Clark. Alison laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The famous alter-ego? How long's he been hanging around?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since I was a kid. Anytime something got broken, or the bathroom got accidentally set on fire - it wasn't me. It was Clark. (Beat.) The weird thing is, he kind of took over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How old were you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, twenty, twenty one... Alison laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, let me tell you, if only you could get rid of that Clark, you could be a real winner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clayton's not going to print anything I write. I've been on salary for six-months and I've written precisely one hundred and seventy five words. On a dollar- per-word basis, I'm the highest paid writer in the history of this magazine.(Beat) He's not going to renew my contract.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you expect, Sidney? Vincent's one of Eleanor's clients. I told you. They're Untouchables.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought Clayton was different. I really did. (Beat) The only thing I'm good at is pissing people off, and he won't let me do it. (Beat) "My glory walks hand in hand with my doom." (Off her look) Troy
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Troy who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Troy, the movie. He stares around him at the other guests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody hates me here. You're the only one who'll talk to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You cornered me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a little embarrassed) No, I mean it. You're the person who's been most, you know... uh...abusive to me. Alison laughs again. They smile at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want another drink?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat, smiling) Alright. I'll have a beer. Sidney walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BAR - DAY 82 Sidney is getting a drink at the bar that has been set up in the grounds. Suddenly he stiffens, watching as Sophie Maes, looking spectacular, walks over to where Maddox and his circle are talking nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sophie, my darling. Looking ravishing as always. Whilst the two are engaged in kissing cheeks, Sidney takes a credit card from his wallet and drops it surreptitiously by Sophie's feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I read the other day? Your collection of poems - The Hollow Heart? Man, they're great. Sidney reacts to this, feeling troubled for some reason.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You write poems?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In another life. The BARMAN is handing out drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And a White Russian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right here. Sidney stares at the drink, feeling like he's just been punched in the stomach. Maddox notices him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, well, if it isn't Sidalee. Maddox notices the card at Sophie's feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (picking it up) What's this? "Hon Young".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's...that's mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But your name's not "Hon".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reaching for it) It's short for "Honourable".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whisking it away) As in, "the Honourable Sidney Young"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I please...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (holding it out of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how come it says "Hon Young"? They made you sound like some Korean medical student. The people gathered around laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They screwed it up. Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sidney baby, you don't wanna go faking a British title to impress Sophie. It's the Fourth of July. (Handing back the card): We're celebrating the fact that we threw a bunch of British aristocrats out. Sidney smiles tightly. Suddenly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you shut up, Maddox? Beat. The others look to Maddox to see how he will react. Maddox smiles dangerously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Careful Sidney. Remember - if it wasn't for us you'd all be speaking German.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're Canadian. If it wasn't for us you'd be speaking French. Sophie giggles. Maddox doesn't like this but before he can answer Sidney walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOUSE - BATHROOM - DAY 83 Alison is about to walk into the bathroom when she hears the sound of muffled sobbing and stops. She peers through the slightly open door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .O.V - Elizabeth Maddox stands at the mirror, staring at her reflection. For once she is not wearing her dark glasses and we can see her eyes are red raw from crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth walks out of the bathroom, dark glasses back in place, her face a mask once more. She walks off. Alison slips out from a nearby room and watches her go, miserable with guilt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOUSE - LATER 85 Sidney is staring over to where Alison and Maddox are standing by some trees, deep in conversation. Maddox is tossing nuts into the air and catching them in his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (muttering to himself) Choke. Choke. He puts his fingers to his temples as if to channel telekinetic powers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Choke...choke... Sidney realizes Harding's wife is passing with her two daughters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Mrs Harding. Lovely party. With a look of alarm she shepherds the girls away. A tall older man dressed in white with a long white beard appears next to Sidney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you? Sidney nods gloomily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has anyone ever told you before that you have an unusually dark aura?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should walk with bare feet as much as possible, ground all that negative energy. Sidney examines him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So...you're a wizard or...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a spiritual healer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can make a living doing that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God no. I'm a dentist. They stare at the party for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to do some coke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um...no, thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachel Petkoff stands talking to some other guests. Sidney notices her and walks over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Hello again? Rachel smiles at him distantly, clearly not remembering him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. (Turning back to the others) No, Lawrence is a wonderful writer. I really felt like he got to the heart of me. Sidney snorts. Rachel turns back to him, faintly irritated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, have we...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sidney. Sidney Young. We met at... Another GUEST walks past Sidney and kisses Rachel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw Five Boroughs the other day and wept!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sidney hovers for a moment, ignored, and then walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dusk. The guests have gathered on the lawns to watch the fireworks. There are oohs and aahs as the rockets light up the sky. Suddenly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) In-ger-lernd! Puzzled the guests turn to where a drunk Sidney is standing on the balustrade of the porch of the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In-ger-lernd! In-ger-lerrrrrrnd! He spots HUGH GRANT amongst the crowd, watching him, puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You! Grant! Come on! In-ger- lerrrr... With that he slips from the balustrade and crashes into the shrubbery below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sidney limps through the trees, dabbing at a scratch on his face. He passes Alison who is sitting on a tree-swing, lost in thought, swigging absently from a bottle of wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine. Yup. Fine. (Beat) You?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yup. (Beat) No, actually. I hate my life so, you know, I'm gonna get drunk. Sidney nods, vaguely. They stand in awkward silence for a moment. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right...See you... He walks off. Beat. He walks back into frame suddenly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the...You...having an affair with Maddox! I mean...Maddox for Christ's sake! The Man With Hidden Shallows! Jesus! I mean, I used to think you were...I was starting to...I mean, at first I thought you were a pain but then I started to think...but I mean...Maddox? How can you live with yourself? Alison stares at him, pale, blinking back tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't. That's why I've broken up with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's no...that's, you know...(Beat) You broke up with him? Alison walks off. Beat. She walks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which leg did you hurt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one. Alison kicks the leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OW! She walks off again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . POOL - EVENING 89 Sidney lies beside the pool staring darkly into the water and nursing the beginnings of a hangover. We hear faint music and laughter from where the party continues in the house behind. He notices the reflection of the starry sky in the water and reaching out gloomily to hold one of the stars. The reflection dissolves into ripples. When the water settles Sophie Maes reflection stares back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She's drunk and a good deal of the movie star mystique seems to have evaporated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what? There's something very damaged about you. Sidney stares at her, not sure what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh... Sophie lies down beside the pool, plays with a strand of her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like an animal that's been hit by a car or something. Like a deer or...like a pig maybe? When they walk funny and the other animals keep away from them. Little limpy pig. I'm drawn to sick animals. That's why I picked Cuba - because he had like psychological problems? (Her eyes well with tears) Poor little Cuba. Where is he now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh... She wipes her eyes, rolls onto her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, I'm wasted. Are you wasted? I'm wasted. Sidney watches her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations on becoming incredibly famous by the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's it like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's what like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything. She rolls her head to look at him solemnly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weird. It's happening so fast and...it's like it's got nothing to do with me. It's like I'm not even really here. She laughs softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're here. She turns back to look at the stars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you...would you like me to get you some food?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you crazy? There might still be a photographer around. They lie in silence for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (DREAMILY) You know what would be nice though? Some coke. She rubs her face, close to falling asleep.

direction.raw_text: Good. Fine. Everything's ...uh...I'm working for this little literary magazine. It's not the New Yorker but... (awkward) So, I've left you a bunch of messages...

direction.raw_text: Sidney? Alison looks past Sidney to the bedroom door where INGRID the Fashionista stands in her underwear.

direction.raw_text: . LA - BEVERLY HILLS HOTEL - DAY 134 Sophie and her entourage, including Sidney and Eleanor, climb out of a line of limousines and walk into the Hotel. We BOOM down from Sophie's fifteen foot laughing face to find Sidney standing on a slim ledge outside his hotel window. He is drunk and wearing only his underwear. He is also yelling with fear. The window behind him is crowded with people shrieking with laughter. Gingerly he edges back to the window and climbs back into...

Calmly she steps out of the window onto the ledge and disappears from sight. The on-lookers crane out of the window, yelling encouragement. After a moment Sophie appears at another window further along the wall and climbs back into the room to ecstatic applause. She stares imperiously at Sidney.

direction.raw_text: ...I can't...

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT 137 Sidney is back in his own room, alone, a mess. He sits on the floor chopping lines of coke on the coffee table. He stares groggily at the space on his finger where his ring used to be.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - we're watching the fifties British movie we saw at the beginning of the film. Sidney's MOTHER is typing at the desk in the background. She gets up from the desk and walks into another office. Sidney stares, frozen. Sidney's mother passes the LEAD ACTRESS who is staring out of the window, smoking. She stares at her sympathetically.

direction.raw_text: . BEVERLY HILTON - EVENING 138 A conveyor belt of limousines arriving outside the Hilton. Rain falls. Celebrities wave to the watching crowds as they make their way up the red carpet, cameras flash... Sophie emerges from a limo, looking amazing. SHE IS WEARING A FUR WRAP. She makes her way up the carpet, Sidney walks behind, smiling vaguely...

direction.raw_text: Well, well... Look at you...

direction.raw_text: . Lawrence Maddox stands beside him, something nervous in his manner now, the old confidence gone. He has been drinking.

direction.raw_text: Made it all the way to the Seventh Room. He holds out his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations. The wheel of fortune right? You go up, I go down. You're here with Sophie? How about doing your old Rabbi a favour and putting in a good word for me? Maybe a little interview? Sidney absent-mindedly takes his hand, looking past him.

direction.raw_text: Is Alison here?

direction.raw_text: Alison? No, we went our separate ways. Actually she left me. Tells me she's in love with someone else. Sidney stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope, not you I'm afraid Sidalee. She threw us both over. Some guy named Clark. I mean...Clark. Can you believe it? But these are the sacrifices we make, right? I don't need to tell you. It's not a vacation. It's a vocation. So listen, about Sophie... But Sidney is no longer listening.

direction.raw_text: . GOLDEN GLOBES AWARDS - EVENING 140 SLOW MOTION - we move in on Sidney, sitting at the table, listening to the Best Actress award. This is where we first met him.

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) This is me at the Golden Globes. That's my Armani tuxedo. That's a Rolex Sea-Dweller 4000 watch I'm wearing. I'm inside. I'm at the centre of everything. I'm right where I wanted to be. Beside him Sophie covers her face with her hands and starts to stand, having just won Best Actress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sidney stares at her hands - she is wearing his gold ring. We move back into real time, sound swells up, thunderous applause. Sidney claps along with the others. Then he stands up and goes after Sophie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taking her arm) I need my ring back. Sophie turns back to him, her smile fixed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need my ring back. As if puzzled by her inability to make it to the stage, Sophie, still smiling, tries to pull her arm free. Eleanor is instantly beside them, trying to disengage Sidney's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling, hissing) What are you doing? Let her go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She isn't the One. My mother gave me that ring and told me I had to give it to the One. She isn't the One. The applause is still going strong. TV Cameras move in on Sophie as she starts to struggle, her smile slipping. Sidney tries to pull the ring free from her finger. Officials move in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just...Will you...I don't want to be on the inside. I don't want to be at the Party. I don't want to have have sex with you. (Beat) I KILLED CUBA! Sophie stares at him for a moment then with a shriek launches herself at him. They tumble backwards. The Officials rush upon them. There are gasps from the other tables, people standing up to see what's going on.

direction.raw_text: . GOLDEN GLOBES AWARDS - CONTINUOUS 145 Sidney bursts free from the scrum of Security and begins to run across the room, overturning a table in the process, Officials racing after him. Sidney sprints for the doors. He notices Vincent Lepak's startled face as he passes it. He stops, ducks back and slaps the back of Vincent's head, knocking the SHADES onto the floor. Sidney stamps on them and runs on. Vincent gapes after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...watching from his table as the people around him stand up to see the chase. He shakes his head in horror and then tries, and fails, to restrain a sudden bark of laughter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEVERLY HILTON - NIGHT 147 Sidney bursts out of the hotel onto the red carpet and is momentarily stopped by the sight of the massed PAPARAZZI ahead, behind the red rope. The Paparazzi stare back at Sidney - his face bruised, shirt collar ripped - equally nonplussed. There is a frozen moment then Sidney plunges forward, ducking under the red rope, back amongst his own kind, pushing through them until he disappears amongst the crowd. 148 INT. LA AIRPORT - TICKET DESK - NIGHT 148 Sidney stands at the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The next available flight is ten am sir. Gets you into New York six thirty PM. Sidney sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LA AIRPORT - NIGHT 149 Sidney sits in the almost deserted terminal waiting for the flight back to New York. He is still wearing his dishevelled tux. He looks down at his tightly clenched hand and slowly opens his fingers to reveal his RING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NEW YORK - NIGHT 150 Sidney is in a cab, still wearing his tux, his travel bag slung over shoulder. He stares out as the cab passes the entrance to a PARK. A sign advertises an outdoor screening of La Dolce Vita.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop the car!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NEW YORK PARK - EVENING 151 An outdoor CINEMA has been set up. LA DOLCE VITA is playing on a large screen. A crowd sits around the park, watching the movie. Sidney stands scanning the crowd. He locates Alison sitting near the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She is holding her notebook, watching the movie. Beside her is the remains of a picnic, with lit candles. Sidney smiles and starts towards her, then stops. She is sitting next to a MAN. As Sidney watches she rests her head on his shoulder. Sidney watches, numb, then turns to walk away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands in front of him in full drag, waving frantically. He starts to run towards Sidney, who sighs and closes his eyes - as if things weren't bad enough. Then Bob runs straight past him. Sidney turns to see the Man next to Alison standing up to embrace Bob. The two kiss.
